channel.title: Comments on: Generic List Provider in C#
channel.description: A Technical Community for IT Professionals

item.title: By: Erik
item.dc:creator: Erik
item.content:encoded:
Would anyone have some hints on how to do what Jim suggested, using attributes instead of property names?

Also, can anyone suggest a rough strategy for plugging in Update functionality so edits can be pushed back into the database?

item.title: By: Jim
item.dc:creator: Jim
item.content:encoded:
Took you example and modified it to use attributes instead of the property names. this way your property names don’t have to look like your datacolumn names from the database.

Great work.
